results.headline: Noble to Buy Rig Rival Diamond Offshore in $1.6 Billion Deal
results.summary: Noble Corp., the world’s biggest offshore oil-rig contractor by market value, agreed to buy its smaller rival Diamond Offshore Drilling Inc. in a deal valued at $1.6 billion.

results.authors: By Mumbi Gitau and Dayanne Sousa
results.headline: Coffee Sees Burst of Volatility as Robusta Supply Fears Persist
results.summary: Coffee futures fluctuated in New York and London as persistent supply concerns continued to add volatility.

results.headline: Ukraine Summit: Some 45 Leaders Plan to Attend Meeting in Switzerland
results.summary: Some 90 countries will attend a Ukraine summit this weekend, Swiss officials said on Monday, but key countries from the so called Global South have still to confirm their attendance.

results.authors: By Maria Elena Vizcaino, Vinicius Andrade, and Davison Santana
results.headline: EM Traders Buy Local Debt as Election Shocks Upend FX Bets
results.summary: Emerging-market investors are turning to local bonds and relative-value currency trades in the aftermath of election shocks that crushed long-standing bets in some of the largest developing economies.

results.authors: By Joel Leon, Ambereen Choudhury, and Archie Hunter
results.headline: Engelhart Grows Power, Gas Trading in Deal to Buy Trailstone
results.summary: Engelhart Commodities Trading Partners has agreed to buy Trailstone in a deal that could create a big player in power trading as firms rush to participate in the volatile electricity markets that have become a key source of industry profits.

results.authors: By Steve Matthews and Craig Stirling
results.headline: Fed Rate Cuts Latest: Dot Plot to Offer Glimpse of Reduction Resolve
results.summary: Investors may glean more on the Federal Reserve’s resolve to ease monetary policy when US policymakers update their forecasts for interest rates Wednesday for the first time in three months.

results.headline: Campos Neto Says Brazil Has to Lower Structural Interest Rates
results.summary: Brazil’s central bank president said it’s necessary to understand that there are several reasons why the country’s neutral structural interest rate is so high, including fiscal policy, and it’s important to fight the cause of the problems.

results.headline: Brazil Sugar Mogul Says Lula’s Fiscal Plan Will Keep Rates High
results.summary: The chairman of Brazilian sugar giant Cosan SA criticized the fiscal policy of President Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva’s government, saying the reforms don’t reduce public debt and will keep interest rates high.

results.authors: By Vince Golle and Molly Smith
results.headline: World Economy Latest: ECB Cuts Rates, US Payrolls Surge
results.summary: The European Central Bank delivered the interest-rate reduction it’s been flagging for months — moving away from a record high — but stopped short of indicating more cuts may follow.

results.authors: By Martha Viotti Beck and Vinicius Andrade
results.headline: Brazil Finance Chief Remarks Fuel Fiscal Worries, Roiling Assets
results.summary: Brazil Finance Minister Fernando Haddad expressed concern about the country’s fiscal outlook during a Friday afternoon meeting with investors, tanking assets and sparking a public attempt to contain the damage.
